security: Revealing the investigation of an individual's family members can be seen as an invasion of privacy and may expose intelligence-gathering methods.
summary: An agent report details derogatory information found on Joachim S. Beer aka Joachim F. Pehl, the step-son of Henry S. Beer, including reports of a fire and disturbing the peace while serving in the US Army Berlin Brigade.
summary_one_paragraph: This agent report, dated 4 March 1971, submitted by Randy L. Thompson of the 66th MI Group, summarizes findings from a check with the Provost Marshal's Office (PMO) of the US Army Berlin Brigade regarding Joachim S. Beer, also known as Joachim F. Pehl, the step-son of Henry S. Beer. The PMO revealed derogatory information including a report of a fire on 19 December 1970, and a complaint of disturbing the peace on 22 January 1971, with no further details provided.
title: AGENT REPORT
